CN.content:
Please identify the "Material Name" entities in the following paragraph.

Paragraph: Using PBDT-TDPP-S as electron donor and PC71BM as electron acceptor , the resulting PSCs exhibited outstanding photovoltaic properties with a PCE of 4.89% , an open - circuit voltage ( V OC ) of 0.84 V , a shortcircuit current ( J SC ) of 10.04 mA cm^-2 , and a fill factor ( FF ) of 56.0% .

Let's think step by step.

1. PBDT-TDPP-S: This is the name of the material used as an electron donor in the Perovskite Solar Cells (PSCs).
2. PC71BM: This is the name of the material used as an electron acceptor in the Perovskite Solar Cells (PSCs).
Please remove irrelevant entities and only keep the entities that clearly refer to Material Name.

1. PBDT-TDPP-S: This is the name of the material used as an electron donor in the Perovskite Solar Cells.
2. PC71BM: This is the name of the material used as an electron acceptor in the Perovskite Solar Cells.

Please present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Material Name".

Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

PN.content:
Please identify the "Property Name" entities in the following paragraph.

Paragraph: Using PBDT-TDPP-S as electron donor and PC71BM as electron acceptor , the resulting PSCs exhibited outstanding photovoltaic properties with a PCE of 4.89% , an open - circuit voltage ( V OC ) of 0.84 V , a shortcircuit current ( J SC ) of 10.04 mA cm^-2 , and a fill factor ( FF ) of 56.0% .

Let's think step by step.

1. PBDT-TDPP-S: This is the name of the electron donor material in the photovoltaic cells (PSCs).
2. PC71BM: This is the name of the electron acceptor material in the photovoltaic cells (PSCs).
3. PCE: This stands for Power Conversion Efficiency. It is a property that measures how effectively the solar cells convert sunlight into electricity.
4. Voc: This stands for Open Circuit Voltage. It is a property that measures the maximum voltage that can be generated by the solar cells under open circuit conditions (no load).
5. Voc (0.84 V): This is the specific value of the Open Circuit Voltage for the given PSCs.
6. Jsc: This stands for Short Circuit Current. It is a property that measures the maximum current that can be generated by the solar cells under short circuit conditions (zero voltage).
7. Jsc (10.04 mA cm^-2): This is the specific value of the Short Circuit Current for the given PSCs.
8. FF: This stands for Fill Factor. It is a property that measures the efficiency of the solar cells in converting the maximum reversible voltage into useful current.
9. FF (56.0%): This is the specific value of the Fill Factor for the given PSCs.
Please remove irrelevant entities and only keep the entities that clearly refer to Material Property.

1. PBDT-TDPP-S: Electron donor material
2. PC71BM: Electron acceptor material
3. PCE: Power Conversion Efficiency (property)
4. Voc: Open Circuit Voltage (property)
5. Jsc: Short Circuit Current (property)
6. FF: Fill Factor (property)

Please present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Property Name".

Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

| Property Name |
| --- |
| Power Conversion Efficiency (PCE) |
| Open Circuit Voltage (Voc) |
| Short Circuit Current (Jsc) |
| Fill Factor (FF) |
| PBDT-TDPP-S (electron donor material) |
| PC71BM (electron acceptor material) |

PV.content:
Please identify the "Property Value" entities in the following paragraph.

Paragraph: Using PBDT-TDPP-S as electron donor and PC71BM as electron acceptor , the resulting PSCs exhibited outstanding photovoltaic properties with a PCE of 4.89% , an open - circuit voltage ( V OC ) of 0.84 V , a shortcircuit current ( J SC ) of 10.04 mA cm^-2 , and a fill factor ( FF ) of 56.0% .

Let's think step by step.

1. PBDT-TDPP-S: This is the electron donor material in the Perovskite Solar Cells (PSCs). It is a specific type of organic-inorganic material used as the active layer in the solar cells.
2. PC71BM: This is the electron acceptor material in the Perovskite Solar Cells (PSCs). It is also an organic material used to accept electrons from the excited state of the donor material.
3. PCE (Power Conversion Efficiency): This is a property value that represents the percentage of the incident light energy that is converted into electrical energy by the solar cells. In this case, the PCE of the PSCs is 4.89%.
4. Voc (Open-circuit Voltage): This is a property value that represents the maximum voltage that can be generated by the solar cells under open-circuit conditions (no load). In this case, the Voc of the PSCs is 0.84 Volts.
5. Jsc (Short-circuit Current): This is a property value that represents the maximum current that can be generated by the solar cells under short-circuit conditions (zero voltage). In this case, the Jsc of the PSCs is 10.04 mA cm^-2.
6. FF (Fill Factor): This is a property value that represents the efficiency of the solar cells in converting the maximum reversible voltage into electrical current. In this case, the FF of the PSCs is 56.0%.
Please remove irrelevant entities and only keep the entities that clearly refer to Value of Material Property.

1. PCE (Power Conversion Efficiency): 4.89%
2. Voc (Open-circuit Voltage): 0.84 V
3. Jsc (Short-circuit Current): 10.04 mA cm^-2
4. FF (Fill Factor): 56.0%

These are the entities in the paragraph that clearly refer to the values of material properties. The other entities, PBDT-TDPP-S and PC71BM, are not properties but rather the materials used in the solar cells.

Please present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Property Value".

Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

| Property Value |
| --- |
| PCE: 4.89% |
| Voc: 0.84 V |
| Jsc: 10.04 mA cm^-2 |
| FF: 56.0% |
